name: Judeoqueer
description:
A short work in progress isometric game about a Jewish teenager in a religious home who is trying to figure out what his place in the world is meant to be.

Work by software developer Joshua Gundlach and 3D artist Ariel Jacob

  • use WASD or arrows to navigate the space.
  • glide the mouse on the screen until you find a glowing V arrow and click to speak with your family or interact with the objects around you.
  • To continue the converation, click on the arrow at the right of the dialogue box. 
  • To end the conversation, click on the cross at the top right corner of the dialogue box.
  • To leave the room, click on the glowing door icon.

Enjoy!

The game demo was exhibited on March 15th at Central Saint Martins, London.
